CustomerManagedS3.description: Used to store channel data in an S3 bucket that you manage. If customer managed storage is selected, the `retentionPeriod` parameter is ignored. You can't change the choice of S3 storage after the data store is created.

ServiceManagedS3.description: Used to store channel data in an S3 bucket managed by ITA . You can't change the choice of S3 storage after the data store is created.

ChannelStorage.description: Where channel data is stored. You may choose one of `serviceManagedS3` , `customerManagedS3` storage. If not specified, the default is `serviceManagedS3` . This can't be changed after creation of the channel.

Bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket in which channel data is stored.

KeyPrefix.description: (Optional) The prefix used to create the keys of the channel data objects. Each object in an S3 bucket has a key that is its unique identifier within the bucket (each object in a bucket has exactly one key). The prefix must end with a forward slash (/).

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the role that grants ITA permission to interact with your Amazon S3 resources.

CustomerManagedS3.description: Used to store channel data in an S3 bucket that you manage.

NumberOfDays.description: The number of days that message data is kept. The `unlimited` parameter must be false.

Unlimited.description: If true, message data is kept indefinitely.

RetentionPeriod.description: How long, in days, message data is kept.

description: The AWS::IoTAnalytics::Channel resource collects data from an MQTT topic and archives the raw, unprocessed messages before publishing the data to a pipeline. For more information, see [How to Use](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/iotanalytics/latest/userguide/welcome.html#aws-iot-analytics-how) in the *User Guide* .

RetentionPeriod.description: How long, in days, message data is kept for the channel.

Tags.description:
Metadata which can be used to manage the channel.

For more information, see [Tag](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-resource-tags.html) .
